comment.author: 18753752@N00
comment._content: Would this be the notification committee we've seen in other pics?

comment.author: 43008542@N00
comment._content:
They certainly look happy. Was this in 1912? 

With the GOP in disarray that year, I'd guess they smell blood in the water, after 44 of the last 52 years having a Republican President.

comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: Many of them seem to have the same hat. Are those Panama hats? I wonder if this meeting had something to do with the Panama canal.

comment.author: 43008542@N00
comment._content: They look like "boater" hats, popularly worn in the summers of that era: www.gentlemansemporium.com/store/hats.php?from=leftnav Top hats were out, and fedora's would not come in for another 15 years or so. The Panama Canal had already been built and fully operational this point, during the Roosevelt administration.

comment.author: 16167252@N00
comment._content: I'm surprised that they're sitting on the grass-- you'd never see that kind of thing these days.

comment.author: 83025347@N00
comment._content: Panama hats come from Ecuador, not Panama. But these are not Panama hats.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Contra a statement above, the Panama Canal was not finished and operational until 1914.
